data.title: best ever
data.text: The creator of this great establishments put a lot of effort into the different environments of each location. They offer wonderful coffee with great food. They offer a great vegan and GF selection as well. Since I am vegan I always applaud when quality vegan options are avail. Overall Temple has a great vibe!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Temple has amazing coffee and very knowledgeable and helpful people working there. I always get a friendly greeting, they normally remember my order, and they have good recommendations if I want to switch things up. I also really like that they have a bunch of vegan pastry options (muffins, donuts, granola bars, and cookies). I love all of their muffins, but my favorite is the Morning Glory because it is loaded with good things like coconut, fruit, and nuts.

data.title: best coffee in sacramento
data.text: when ever I am in downtown Sacramento I make a point to go to Temple. the baristas a great and the coffee even better.

data.title: Great Coffee in the heart of downtown Sacramento
data.text: Great Coffee in the heart of downtown Sacramento.  Once the Arena opens up this will be a great hang out for sure.  Pastries are good, nice variety of coffee as well as other customized drinks.  I try to visit at least once every two weeks.

data.title: Love
data.text: Have gone to other locations in the Sacramento area and just love the coffee and the hot chocolate and the service. Definitely a place to go hang out and relax!

data.title: A Brew-tiful Place!!
data.text: This place is incredible! A beautiful bar with the most incredible cappuccino (Dharma Expresso) ever! I love my coffee and have had it in many places all over the world, and this cappuccino was one of the best. The atmosphere was beautiful as well with a lacquered floor of pennies and nice industrial like decor, but the icing on the cake was the baristas whose friendly and non-intimidating personalities made the whole experience pleasant and welcoming. I was only in Sacramento for five days, but went to both locations. The other was near a university and a little more crowded, but the coffee and baristas were just as pleasant! As Schwarzenegger says, "Ah'll be back."

data.title: Great fair trade coffee, friendly baristas
data.text: This location of Temple Coffee is in a great central location for downtown businesses. They feature fair-trade coffee and teas, plus pastries. The staff are always helpful and friendly. I highly recommend Temple's latte.

data.title: Quick pick me up
data.text:
Neat and tidy, clean lines and attentive staff greet you when you enter the location. Each cup of coffee is freshly ground and brewed.  None of the pre-brewed pumper pot coffee here.  Freshly baked goodies to tempt any palate await in a display case.  We had a Gilbralter (pictured) which is lovingly crafted.  An almond milk latte with 4 shots.  The kicker was when I ordered a decaf coffee.  Decaf latte? No, just a plain decaf.  Decaf espresso? No, I just want a regular decaf coffee.  No latte, no espresso.  The coffees were fine, served directly to you once they were made.  Flavor was smooth, mild, with no acidic after taste.  We sat and enjoyed the conversation and coffee.

The tables are long group tables where one or more can sit alone or in groups.  There is plenty of room to sit and enjoy your coffee and low conversation among your party.  A few people were hooked up to the wifi and workstation counter at the front of the store.  Lots of regulars coming in for their "usual" or picking up some freshly ground coffee beans (to order).  Nice place to stop for a cup of freshly brewed  coffee (or tea).

data.title: Hands Down, Amazing Coffee
data.text: Temple, winner of national coffee taste testing, will reward upon first entry on the premises.The aroma for coffee lovers will put in you in a good, if not anticipatory mood.  So many choices, so l little time since too much caffeine in a day can knock your socks off. Solution: come again and again, or take home a bag of their top tier coffee.

data.title: For serious coffee drinkers
data.text: OK it's kind of hipster place, but the choices of coffee, and the way they are prepared make this the place for serious coffee people. The staff does a great job to explain the featured varieties and you have the choice of French Press or Pour Over. Very popular on Saturday there was a long queue. Popular place where locals meet up.

data.title: Serious 'spro
data.text: Sacramento has several top coffee establishments and this is one of them. It's worth the price of admission just to see a barista work a top-notch piston-driven machine. I'm not up to fully describing their espresso roast, but I think most espresso-drink habitués will love it. I've been there a handful of times on visits over the last couple of years, never a hiccup. The food choice is minimal, but I had a really good scone on this last visit. If you like them with sugar on top, don't go to Temple.

data.title: For Coffee Aficionado...
data.text:
Those who love coffee and in Sacramento should stop by at Temple Coffee. When you first walked in, you will wake up and smell the coffee. They have different techniques to serve your coffee, and the barista is very patient in answering your questions and explaining the technique that he is performing. 

And enjoy that first sip of your coffee til the very last drip.

The ambiance of the whole place is nice to hang out too.

data.title: Good Coffee!
data.text: We went to Temple Coffee after reading the reviews, and were pleased.  The decor is very pleasing. The server was very knowledgeable and although we enjoyed our coffee, I think her description of it tasted even better!  If you enjoy a real doffee, pass o Starbucks, Peet's, etc., and head over here.

data.title: Coffee was worth the hype
data.text: The place was spacious and served a variety of coffees and although not a connoisseur it seemed like a thoughtfully crafted list of options. Just took the basic cappuccino, but even that tasted really good and very different to the run-of-the-mill places. Tried a muffin as well, and it was moist from the inside and tasted great. Don't expect many varieties of sweet bites though, as the place is focused only on coffee. Worth a try if you are a coffee person.

data.title: Coffee Snob? Go Here!
data.text:
I admit, I'm pretty particular about my coffee. I read the reviews and decided to take a one mile morning walk to taste for myself and it was so worth it.

Aside from the chill atmosphere, lovely people, and great coffees, there is a row of gluten-free and vegan pastries. This meant that my vegan colleague was willing to come with me the following morning and she loved Temple too.

Both mornings, I had a french press and enjoyed every sip. What a great way to start my Sacramento mornings. So happy I found it.

data.title: Tea lover? Visit!
data.text:
I LOVE the smell of coffee but don't like the taste. But I visited here as part of a Local Roots Food Tour and fell in love with Temple Coffee.

It was recommended to try the Bliss tea. So I recommend it to you, the tea lover.

Its a nice atmosphere with lots natural light and plug-ins, so if you need to work, study or have a quiet conversation - this is your place.

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text:
Stopped in to this location off 9th Street in downtown Sacramento. I have had the coffee served at work meetings and never stopped in until recently. 

I came in one morning. Line was short. The staff helping me was prompt and friendly. Staff was friendly and thorough. 

I ordered a Guatemalan Luis Pedro Duaranzito by coffee press. He offered instructions but I opted out. The coffee was prepped in press with, to go cup for me request, and a timer. 

I used the press and timer. I took my cup to go. I didn't add any cream or sugar. This coffee by itself explains plenty. Rich in flavor. Bold in taste. Not bitter. One of the best coffees I have ever had.

My experience here explains why this place is rated one of the top coffee places in the United States.

data.title: Wonderful afternoon and wonderful latte!
data.text: Stopped by Temple and loved the atmosphere.  Gorgeous long wooden tables draw you in as does the robust coffee wafting from the roasters.  Love having a latte in a REAL cup...sat and read a while and enjoyed watching everyone come and go!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Great place for locals. They have another location which is great too because it has parking, I believe its on S and 29th.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Fantastic coffee and tea; huge variety of flavors. Great atmosphere, great people and a lovely patio out front. I found myself going out of my way to stop here for coffee.
